item.title: [Python] A guidebook for doing IoT with MicroPython at the last minute
item.description: This article is the second day of [Python Part 2 Advent Calendar 2019](https://qiita.com/advent-calendar/2019/python2).Thefirstdaywas@ssh-22's[Advancedstringreplacementusingre.sub](https://qiita.com/ssh-22/items/a42ca0fe7ead4d280bfc). Arduino, Raspberry Pi is a rapidly growing ecosystem in the IoT area, but Raspberry Pi can be implemented in Python, but Arduino is much easier to use for a little electronic control. However, there are probably people who want to write in Python, which is familiar to them, rather than the Arduino language (like C/C++). In this article, I would like to write a guide to easily start development using MicroPython, which is embedded Python, in a financial sense.
